channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.K. Teenager Who Killed 3 Girls in Southport Stabbing to Be Sentenced Today
item.description: Axel Rudakubana, 18, pleaded guilty to murder and attempted murder after attacking children and two adults at a dance class last July.

item.title: Why Is Israel Targeting Jenin, West Bank?
item.description: As Israel withdraws some of its troops from Gaza during a cease-fire there, it has turned attention to another Palestinian territory — in particular a...

item.description: Axel Rudakubana, 18, pleaded guilty to murder and attempted murder after attacking children and two adults at a dance class last July.

item.title: Zelensky Could Face Tough Re-election Prospects, Polls Show
item.description: The high popularity that the Ukrainian president had in the early days of the Russian invasion, with an approval rating of about 90 percent, has dippe...

item.title: Yan-David Erlich, former Weights and Biases executive, joins B Capital as general partner
item.description: Yan-David Erlich, previously CRO and COO at AI unicorn Weights & Biases, is joining B Capital, he exclusively tells Fortune.

item.title: Are famous short sellers going extinct? The exit of Hindenburg Research and Andrew Left shows the risky trade is shrinking
item.description: Indicted short seller Andrew Left tells Fortune a “chilling effect” is making “everyone think twice.”

item.title: Hughes Fire Burns 10,000 Acres as Dangerous Conditions Persist in Southern California
item.description: The blaze temporarily closed parts of Interstate 5 and prompted evacuation orders and warnings for more than 50,000 people. Red flag fire warnings wer...

item.title: South Korea Tells Budget Airlines to Tighten Safety After Crash
item.description: Following the deadly Jeju Air accident, the government ordered low cost carriers to reduce flight times, boost pilot training and expand maintenance c...

item.title: House approves Laken Riley Act immigrant detention bill that would be Trump’s first law to sign
item.description: A crucial faction of 46 politically vulnerable Democrats joined with Republicans to lift the strict proposal to passage on a 263-156 vote tally.

item.title: Trump could paralyze a key U.S. surveillance watchdog, threatening Big Tech’s ability to serve Europe
item.description: The Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board (PCLOB) may lose its ability to function by the end of Thursday, undermining a key U.S.-EU agreement.

item.title: Israeli Forces Kill 2 Men in Jenin Who They Say Were Wanted for Murder
item.description: The men were affiliated with a militant group, Palestinian Islamic Jihad, that carried out an attack earlier this month, the military said.

item.title: How Nike’s new CEO plans to rebound from its worst year ever
item.description: A Fortune profile of Elliott Hill chronicles his career journey at the retailer and a turnaround strategy.

item.title: Israeli Forces Kill 2 Men in Jenin Who They Say Were Wanted for Murder
item.description: The men were affiliated with a militant group, Palestinian Islamic Jihad, that carried out an attack earlier this month, the military said.

item.title: ExThera Claimed Its Device Could Cure Cancer. But Patients Died.
item.description: Two U.S. companies teamed up to treat cancer patients using an unproven blood filter in Antigua, out of reach of American regulators.
